definition: to lose/to leave behind/to omit/to bequeath/sth lost/involuntary discharge (of urine etc)

sentences.english: Now 2,513 of them have returned to Japan.
sentences.chinese: 至今已有2513名日本遺孤返日定居。

sentences.english: Wen first of all expressed welcome to the delegation.
sentences.chinese: 溫家寶首先歡迎日本遺孤感恩團來訪。

sentences.english: I have heard that some social groups to help AIDS orphans is on the back.
sentences.chinese: 有些社會團體一聽到幫助的是艾滋病人遺孤就卻步了。

sentences.english: So, we are the same person is poor, the revolutionary martyrs orphan.
sentences.chinese: 所以，我倆是一樣的苦命人，都是革命先烈的遺孤。

sentences.english: Unless their parents having died, and the orphanage can not accept these orphans .
sentences.chinese: 而除非他們父母雙亡，孤兒院又不能接受這些遺孤。

sentences.english: Many children orphaned by the Holocaust stayed with their adopted families.
sentences.chinese: 許多大屠殺的遺孤和收養他們的家庭一起生活。

sentences.english: Secondly, to enhance the social status of HIV orphans.
sentences.chinese: 第二，提升了艾滋遺孤的社會地位。
